clues.text:
November 19:
Saint Rainier's Day

March 17:
A certain saint's day

April 30:
Queen's Day, celebrating the 1909 birth of Juliana & the 1980 accession of her daughter Beatrix

November 3:
Separation Day, commemorating its 1903 split with Colombia

Celebrating the Grito de Dolores

One single member of the "Bronx Bombers"

A general wears one & so does a private

It's equal to 1,000 grams

A place to stay when on vacation

A New World capital city
Drop a letter from "fraction" to get this fraction of a group within a larger group

Shirley MacLaine was one of the few female members of this fabled group that also included Dean Martin & Frank Sinatra
At school, kids inevitably form these exclusive groups of friends, from the French for "noise"
A synonym for group, it's often applied to "beauties" & is a collective noun for several swans

"The Rainbow ____"

"On Beyond ____"

"Days with ____ and ____"
(2 different amphibians)

This oldest clothing retailer in the U.S. formed in 1818; the grandchildren, all brothers, took over in 1850

This company started in 1833 selling mollusk exoskeletons; it switched to selling oil for lamps in the 1890s
Baltimore Orioles defensive wizard Brooks Robinson won 16 straight gold these from 1960 to 1975
Featherweight Willie Pep was so brilliant on defense, he once won a round by deliberately not doing this

In 2010 Boston unveiled a statue of this 1970s Bruins defenseman

Cape Sable, the USA's southernmost mainland point, lies within this Florida national park
In 1623 this Massachusetts cape was named for the then-queen of England
In 1938 the German ship Admiral Karpfanger was mysteriously lost off this Chilean cape
The entrance to this Australian bay near Sydney is guarded by Cape Banks & Cape Solander
Cape Spartel, 6 miles west of Tangier, is the point where the Atlantic Ocean & this strait meet
Somniloquism is doing this in one's sleep; it could get you in trouble
Eremology is the study of these, like the Gobi
We could call this vocabulary category (one of our favorites) TETRAGRAMS
An agelast is someone who never does this, not aloud, not even last; how sad
In math you get a difference by subtracting the subtrahend from this number
He published the first edition of "Leaves of Grass" at his own expense & even set some of the type for it
Upon this woman's death in 1886, her sister Lavinia found nearly 1,000 poems hidden away in her bureau
Shortly after becoming engaged to Sarah Shelton, he fell ill in a Baltimore tavern & died 4 days later on October 7, 1849
This family of poets born in & around Boston includes Amy, James Russell & Robert
In "Concord Hymn", he wrote, "Here once the embattled farmers stood, and fired the shot heard round the world"
Mark Harmon investigates all crimes involving U.S. Navy & Marine Corps personnel on this drama
Hawkeye & Trapper John shared a tent called The Swamp on this sitcom
In April 2009 the doors of Chicago's County General Hospital closed to TV viewers as this show ended
Ponch & Jon were motorcycle cops on this '70s police drama
The beer-drinking MacKenzie brothers were a staple on this comedy show whose full name once included "Network 90"

rounds.text: The first recorded use of this word in print was when Nathan Hope posted an image of his busted lip online in 2002
